name: Passport
description: International travel document issued by government authorities. Critical for international travel and identification abroad.
replacementInstructions: Contact your country's passport office or embassy. Requires application form, photos, proof of identity, and fees. Processing can take 4-8 weeks or longer. For urgent travel, expedited services may be available at additional cost.

name: National ID
description: Government-issued identification card proving citizenship and identity. Essential for voting, banking, and official transactions.
replacementInstructions: Visit your local registration office or apply online. Requires application form, photos, proof of citizenship, and fees. Processing typically takes 2-4 weeks. Temporary ID may be issued immediately.

name: Birth Certificate
description: Official document certifying the details of a person's birth. Required for obtaining other identification documents and legal purposes.
replacementInstructions: Contact the vital records office in the state/country where you were born. Requires application form, proof of identity, and fees. Processing can take 2-6 weeks. May require notarized copies for official use.

name: School ID
description: Student identification card issued by educational institutions. Used for campus access, library services, and student discounts.
replacementInstructions: Contact your school's registrar or student services office. Usually requires application form and may have a small fee. Processing typically takes 1-2 weeks. Some schools issue temporary IDs immediately.

name: Driving Licence
description: Official authorization to operate motor vehicles. Required for legal driving and often used as identification.
replacementInstructions: Visit your local motor vehicle department or apply online. Requires application form, proof of identity, and fees. Processing typically takes 1-3 weeks. Temporary license may be issued immediately. May require retaking written or practical test if expired.

name: Work ID
description: Employee identification card issued by employer. Used for building access, time tracking, and employee benefits.
replacementInstructions: Contact your HR department or security office. Usually requires a simple request form. Processing typically takes 1-3 business days. Temporary access may be arranged immediately.

name: Professional License
description: License to practice a profession (e.g., medical, legal, engineering). Required for legal practice in regulated fields.
replacementInstructions: Contact the licensing board for your profession. Requires application form, proof of identity, and fees. Processing can take 2-6 weeks. May require verification of credentials and continuing education records.

name: Marriage Certificate
description: Official document certifying a marriage. Required for name changes, spousal benefits, and legal purposes.
replacementInstructions: Contact the vital records office where the marriage was registered. Requires application form, proof of identity, and fees. Processing can take 2-6 weeks. May require notarized copies for official use.

name: Diploma
description: Official document certifying completion of an educational program. Important for employment and further education.
replacementInstructions: Contact your educational institution's registrar office. Requires application form, proof of identity, and fees. Processing can take 2-4 weeks. Official transcripts may be required as proof of completion.

name: Transcript
description: Official academic record showing courses taken and grades earned. Required for transfer credits and graduate applications.
replacementInstructions: Contact your educational institution's registrar office. Requires application form, proof of identity, and fees. Processing typically takes 1-2 weeks. Official transcripts are usually sealed and may require special handling.

name: Alien Registration Card
description: Identification card for non-citizens legally residing in a country. Essential for work authorization and legal status.
replacementInstructions: Contact immigration services or the appropriate government agency. Requires application form, proof of legal status, photos, and fees. Processing can take 4-8 weeks or longer. May require biometric appointment.

name: Social Security Card
description: Government-issued card with Social Security Number. Required for employment, tax purposes, and government benefits.
replacementInstructions: Contact Social Security Administration office or apply online. Requires application form, proof of identity and citizenship, and may have fees. Processing typically takes 1-2 weeks. Limited replacements allowed per year.

name: Health Insurance Card
description: Insurance card providing proof of health coverage. Required for medical services and prescription medications.
replacementInstructions: Contact your insurance provider by phone or online portal. Usually free replacement. Processing typically takes 5-10 business days. Temporary card may be available immediately via email or app.

name: Vaccination Card
description: Official record of vaccinations received. Important for travel, school enrollment, and health records.
replacementInstructions: Contact your healthcare provider or local health department. May require contacting multiple providers if vaccinated at different locations. Processing can take 1-2 weeks. Records may be available electronically.
